context_evidences: - In 2009, Anonymous -- a group Arash says is funded entirely from donations -- helped launch the opposition support website Anonymous Iran . The site was launched as a platform for exchanging information between Iran and the world and now claims over 15,000 users. Reference: https://www.rferl.org/a/iran_hackers_anonymous_cyberarmy_opposition_internet/2313350.html published on 2011-02-18 00:00:00

- Not only has the regime ignored the rights of Iranian women, but also it has completely misread the world’s increased commitment to gender equality and thus underestimated one of the most powerful political issues of the 21st century. Across most of the globe, there’s nothing controversial or even questionable about supporting women’s rights. Reference: https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2022/11/08/iran-protests-womens-rights-social-media-explainer/ published on 2022-11-08 12:00:55

- The Islamic republic is a gender-apartheid state. That structure means the regime would be incapable of addressing the demands of its female population even if it wanted to. It also leaves the government horribly unequipped to understand the pulse of the modern world. Reference: https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2022/11/08/iran-protests-womens-rights-social-media-explainer/ published on 2022-11-08 12:00:55

- The greatest worry is that one might inadvertently strengthen the position of hardliners in Tehran while at the same time weakening the hand of moderates. Statements of sympathy and understanding for demonstrators and their cause have once again highlighted the divergent approaches taken by Europe and the United States when it comes to dealing with Iran. Reference: https://www.dw.com/en/iran-protests-eu-urges-restraint-us-and-israel-up-pressure/a-42019365 published on 2018-01-03 19:25:19

- Röttgen believes that Trump has lost all credibility on the issue because "he is constantly trying to mobilize the Sunni world against Iran." Röttgen said that Europe and Germany, in contrast, have maintained credibility: "We stand by the nuclear deal , which will bring economic relief to the people by loosening sanctions. And that gives us a completely different level of credibility, one that we should actively leverage — albeit, within realistic limits." Reference: https://www.dw.com/en/iran-protests-eu-urges-restraint-us-and-israel-up-pressure/a-42019365 published on 2018-01-03 19:25:19

- The Tor project is a project designed to give people a safe way to use the Internet anonymously and securely. But Iran is the first country to block that software. We know how powerful Iran's Islamic regime is, and we know it's hard fighting against them. But we have hope. And we are lucky because we are fighting on the side of the people of Iran. There are other anonymity tools, which the government has not yet blocked. Reference: https://www.rferl.org/a/iran_hackers_anonymous_cyberarmy_opposition_internet/2313350.html published on 2011-02-18 00:00:00
correction_response: This tweet is potentially misleading. While it suggests that the unrest in Iran was orchestrated by external forces, it's important to note that there are multiple factors contributing to the situation. For instance, the Iranian government's disregard for women's rights and gender equality has been a significant source of discontent (https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2022/11/08/iran-protests-womens-rights-social-media-explainer/). Additionally, the role of international actors is complex. While some, like the US and Israel, have been accused of supporting the protests, others like the EU have urged restraint to avoid empowering hardliners in Iran (https://www.dw.com/en/iran-protests-eu-urges-restraint-us-and-israel-up-pressure/a-42019365). Furthermore, the involvement of groups like Anonymous in supporting Iranian opposition online is not necessarily indicative of a comprehensive external plot, but rather a global movement against censorship (https://www.rferl.org/a/iran_hackers_anonymous_cyberarmy_opposition_internet/2313350.html).
note_1_text: There is no evidence to the claims being made that the protests in Iran are a result of outside forces.     The protests began as a response to the death of Mahsa Amini while detained by the IRG and have continued as a demand for women’s right and general freedoms in Iran.     https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-63118637
note_2_text: Khamenei may be referring to groups such as US-funded NED, which have provided funding to opposition groups in the past.    However, this perspective avoids taking responsibility for the numerous, widely-reported problems in Iran from which genuine protest might arise.    https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021%E2%80%932023_Iranian_protests  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mahsa_Amini_protests  https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/cbp-9679/  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Endowment_for_Democracy  https://twitter.com/NEDemocracy/status/1573033864779468801  https://powerbase.info/index.php/NED,_CIA,_and_the_Orwellian_Democracy_Project

refute_evidences: - Norbert Röttgen, a parliamentarian from Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservative Christian Democratic Union (CDU) who chairs the Bundestag's foreign affairs committee, warned that carelessly expressed opinions could allow leaders in Tehran to claim that the uprising is being orchestrated from abroad. Reference: https://www.dw.com/en/iran-protests-eu-urges-restraint-us-and-israel-up-pressure/a-42019365 published on 2018-01-03 19:25:19

- That's the inscrutable "voice" of international Internet collective Anonymous , a shadowy organization that has carried out a number of attacks on websites worldwide.In recent days, with Iranians taking to the streets to protest against the government, the country's Islamic authorities have boosted their censorship efforts in a bid to crush opposition activity online. Reference: https://www.rferl.org/a/iran_hackers_anonymous_cyberarmy_opposition_internet/2313350.html published on 2011-02-18 00:00:00

- Arash is a hacker who works with Anonymous to fight government censorship and cybercontrol in his native Iran. It's hard to pin down what exactly Anonymous is. The organization has no leaders and no headquarters and grew out of image-sharing forums in the United States. Reference: https://www.rferl.org/a/iran_hackers_anonymous_cyberarmy_opposition_internet/2313350.html published on 2011-02-18 00:00:00

- Turkish Foreign Minister Meslut Cavusoglu also claimed that the US and Israel were supporting the protests . Speaking with CNN Turk, Cavusoglu said that his country was opposed to any form of outside interference in Iran. Reference: https://www.dw.com/en/iran-protests-eu-urges-restraint-us-and-israel-up-pressure/a-42019365 published on 2018-01-03 19:25:19
tweet_text: The enemy had a comprehensive plot for the recent unrest in Iran. In my heart, I thought about how well the enemy had engineered this. It was well engineered. So why did they fail? Because on the other hand, their calculations were wrong.
user_description: News, messages, and statements from Imam Sayyid Ali Khamenei, Iran's Supreme Leader--- ES: @es_Khamenei l RU: @Khameneiru l FA: @Khamenei_fa l AR: @ar_Khamenei
